SIDE.Alfresco.name: SIDE.Alfresco
SIDE.Alfresco.description:
This module provides helpers to make use of Alfresco features easier.
In a near future, these helpers may augment native Alfresco classes
so its use is transparent for developers and can be integrated into
existing applications without breaking anything.
SIDE.Alfresco.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

SIDE.Alfresco.Workflow.name: SIDE.Alfresco.Workflow
SIDE.Alfresco.Workflow.description:
This library provides helper functions to dynamically create all kind of
workflow start script. A rule will generally be created later to call
this script.

SIDE.application.initialization.name: SIDE.application.initialization
SIDE.application.initialization.description:
This class contains all the initialization data to bootstrap
a complete Requisition application. It's the generic part.

SIDE.application.requisition.bizrule.name: SIDE.application.requisition.bizrule
SIDE.application.requisition.bizrule.description:
Creates a folder with the name of the provided file.

Other bizrules should have been put here instead of generating them
or importing them through the 'side' Alfresco Share site

SIDE.application.requisition.initializat.name: SIDE.application.requisition.initialization
SIDE.application.requisition.initializat.description:
This class creates Alfresco Rules required by the Procurement application:

* a rule to launch workflow automaticallyinitWorkflowStartScriptCreation();
* a rule to fill pdf with Order metadata
* a rule to create a directory from a freshly created Order, so the user
may add some attachments

Start.name: Start
Start.description:
This library provides helper functions to dynamically create all kind of
workflow start script. A rule will generally be created later to call
this script.
Start.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

Group.name: Group
Group.description:
This class provides helpers to make Alfresco group
management easier. To augment group native Alfresco
should be a good idea.

People.name: People
People.description:
This is a test to augment through people renaming in peopleAlfresco and
people inheriting from it
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/NoSuchMethod
People.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

Person.name: Person
Person.description:
This class is a very light design of the Person concept
Ideally, it should have augmented the person object provided by Alfresco
but it doesn't seem to be possible
Person.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

Remote.name: Remote
Remote.description:
This class provides a wrapper around a native java class to execute
remote web service call through whatever URL. This may be seen as
a security hole. Use at your own risk.
Remote.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

Rule.name: Rule
Rule.description:
This class creates Alfresco Rules required by the Procurement application:

* a rule to launch workflow automaticallyinitWorkflowStartScriptCreation();
* a rule to fill pdf with Order metadata
* a rule to create a directory from a freshly created Order, so the user
may add some attachments
Rule.author: Jean-christophe Kermagoret

Bootstrap.name: Bootstrap
Bootstrap.description:
This class contains all the initialization data to bootstrap
a complete Requisition application. It's the generic part.

DirectoryTree.name: DirectoryTree
DirectoryTree.description:
This class creates the directory structure in the baseDir. In parallel,
the corresponding groups are created and the permissions indicated
in the folders attribute are assigned.

Requirement: Provided base groups must be created so nested groups
can be initialized correctly.
DirectoryTree.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret
todo:
Groups are created at a global level and so should be prepended by
the site short name

The '_' char is used as a separator in group names which are based
on directories' names. This means it's not possible to have '_' in path
which is not a good idea. The '_' should be doubled to reduce future
problems

OrderFolder.name: OrderFolder
OrderFolder.description:
Creates a folder with the name of the provided file.

Other bizrules should have been put here instead of generating them
or importing them through the 'side' Alfresco Share site
OrderFolder.author: Jean-Christophe Kermagoret

Config.name: Config
Config.description:
This class describes all the initialization data to bootstrap
a complete Procurement Requisition application. This part is specific
to each application.

classitems.description:
All the methods available in the native people object are also available
through the __noSuchMethod__ mechanism
classitems.name: all

classitems.description: This method is transmitted in a second time to the people object
classitems.name: getPerson

classitems.description: Based on http://www.techbits.de/2011/12/02/using-the-javascript-console-creating-users-with-avatar-images/

params.name: _id
params.description:
If no id is provided, an random one will
be created

classitems.description:
Compare Property Value
operation:= BEGINS|ENDS|CONTAINS
Action Rules Templates

Initializes the bootstrap process by creating all the required
elements for a requisition application.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Base groups must exist before the directories' creation. Indeed,
final directories from the site structure will be included into
these base groups.

Users are created with an avatar if a people-username.png image
is available somewhere in the Alfresco repository

Users need to have SiteConsumer right on the application site
in order to see it

Users are not directly included into the application groups. They
are included into the organization groups which are, in their turn,
included into the application groups, corresponding to the ones
used by the workflows.
Creates the Alfresco Share site
classitems.name: createSite

classitems.description: Creates site structure
classitems.name: createSiteStructure

classitems.description: Creates the js script to start workflow for Requisition
classitems.name: createWorkflowStartScript

classitems.description:
Creates rules for requisition application into the leaves of the
previously created directory structure
classitems.name: createRules

classitems.description: Creates users so you can play with the application directly
classitems.name: createUsers

classitems.description:
Adds users in the groups used by the workflow. They are different from
the ones created for the directory structure which manage content access
through a set of explicit permissions.
classitems.name: addUsersInApplicationSiteGroup

classitems.description:
Creates groups used by the workflows. Without these groups, workflows
are unusable.
classitems.name: createApplicationGroups

classitems.description:
Adds users in organization groups so you can really access the data
and use the application. Indeed, organization groups are included into
application groups so, by transitivity, you'll be able to manage the
workflow in relation with your membership.
classitems.name: addUsersInOrganizationGroups

classitems.description: Initializes the organization browsing
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description:
Recursely browses the soft directory (corresponding to the organization)
and creates the real one in the same time. Once the soft directory hasn't
any more children, the application groups, folders and permissions are
set.

Note that organization groups is just a structure which isn't in any ways
related to the formal idea of an entity. Your soft directory is simply
a tree!
classitems.name: browse

params.name: softDirectory
params.description:
the current object in the organization's
structure

classitems.description:
Creates the permissions for the provided parent.

#### Directories' permissions

Permissions are created as a set of russian dolls. Imagine the
following directory structure:

	ACME
	  HR
	    Staffing
	    Training
	  Financial
	    Payroll
	    Accounting

Permissions will be created as a flattened structure:

	ACME
	ACME_HR
	ACME_HR_Staffing
	...
	ACME_Financial_Payroll
	...

And each group includes all the groups that start with its name. So:

	ACME includes ACME_HR and ACME_Financial
	ACME_HR includes ACME_HR_Staffing and ACME_HR_Training
	ACME_Financial includes ACME_Financial_Payroll and ACME_Financial_Accounting

From a security point of view, this way to manage permissions allows to
prevent users to browse directories not corresponding to those they
are not membership of. Explicit permissions are preferred to inheritance which may be dangerous
because of implicit behavior. In security, explicit rules can be viewed like
everything is denied by default.

#### Application permissions

This part tries to implement this kind of security matrix.

Beside this basic permission structure, you can refine it at the leaves
level with more appropriate basic rights corresponding to your application
requirements. The following rights are generated:

	NA: Nothing Available
	RO: Read Only

Else if you are a Drafter, you have Read/Write/CreateChildren (kind of RWC).
Otherwise you have Read rights (Kind of RO)
classitems.name: createPermissions

params.name: parent
params.description:
is the directory for which permissions are going
to be created.

params.name: path
params.description:
is the complete path corresponding to the parent
It should normally be deduced from the parent but a bug (?) prevented me to
achieve it, so I needed this path. Don't forget to update the doc if parent
is enough.

classitems.description:
Creates the folders provided during DirectoryTree instanciation. This
corresponds to leaves in the directory tree.
classitems.name: createFolder

params.name: parent
params.description:
is the directory under which will be created
the folders

classitems.description:
Creates the application groups for the current parent corresponding
to directory leaves
classitems.name: createApplicationFinalGroups

classitems.description:
Converts path to a group name by removing all the Alfresco Share site
part (documentLibrary included). In fact, Group name corresponds to the relative
part of the path in a Share site from a user point of view.
Creates a folder with the name of the provided file.

This property stores the organization's structure as a tree.
It is used as a base to create the main directory layout. You may
have as many levels as you want. This is called organization but
could have been called tree. No semantics at all related to an
organization.
classitems.name: organization

classitems.description:
Once the previous organization structure is available, following
folders are created into the leaves: e.g. ITS in the previous case.
For each folder, permissions for each group are available in
a very simple format of the form: Group(_Permission)? where permission
may be:

* RO: Read-Only
* NA: Not Available
* nothing
classitems.name: applicationFolders

classitems.description:
Test users. They are used to populate the application's group
so you can test it in a standalone mode.
classitems.name: persons

classitems.description:
This property stores the application roles which will be used
to create required application groups. They are also used to create
the base groups for the organization.
You can of course provide your own group and insert them into
the application's groups.
classitems.name: applicationGroups

classitems.description:
This property stores the application roles which will be used
to create required application groups. They are also used to create
the base groups for the organization.
You can of course provide your own group and insert them into
the application's groups.
classitems.name: organizationGroups
